definition[0]: an international organization that was set up in 2006 and which publishes information that governments would prefer to keep secret from the public. In 2010 WikiLeaks released a film showing a 2007 attack by a US helicopter in which civilians and journalists died. In the same year the organization released more than 76,000 documents about the War in Afghanistan. In 2010 WikiLeaks released 400,000 documents about the War in Iraq. The main spokesman for the organization is Julian Assange.
